===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|だい|しょう}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=だいしょう|大|tr1=dai|t1=big, large|小|tr2=shō|t2=small, little}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|だいしょう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|だいしょう}}

# [[large]] and [[small]]
# the traditional [[Japanese]] pair of swords, consisting of the {{m|ja|大刀|tr=daitō||big blade|pos=i.e. [[katana]]}} and {{m|ja|小刀|tr=shōtō||small blade|pos=i.e. [[wakizashi]]}}
# a pair of [[taiko]] drums, consisting of one large and one small taiko
# [[long]] [[month]]s and [[short]] months:
## in the [[lunar calendar]], long months of 30 days and short months of 29 days
## in the [[solar]] [[calendar]], long months of 31 days and short months of 30 days or less

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|おお|さ}}
Appears to be a compound of {{etyl|ojp|-}}-derived {{m|ja|大|tr=ō||big}} + {{m|ja|小|tr=sa||small|pos=rare reading}}. Alternatively, may be {{m|ja|大|tr=ō||big}} + {{m|ja|さ|tr=-sa||pos=suffix indicating degree or amount}}.

Appears to be mostly obsolete in modern Japanese, superseded by the term {{m|ja|大きさ|tr=ōkisa||size|lit=bigness}}, from adjective {{m|ja|大きい|tr=ōkii||big}}. The modern Japanese term with the reading of ''ōsa'' is {{m|ja|多さ|tr=ōsa|lit=much-ness, many-ness}}, from adjective {{m|ja|多い|tr=ōi||many, much}}, deriving from the same {{etyl|ojp|-}} root ''opo'' as {{m|ja|大きい|tr=ōkii||big}}.
